pli-tv-bu-vb-sk37:0.2: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk37:0.5: 37. The training rule on asking for rice and bean curry
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk37:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk37:1.2: At that time the monks from the group of six ate rice and bean curry that they themselves had asked for.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk37:1.4: “How can the Sakyan ascetics eat rice and bean curry that they themselves have asked for?
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk37:1.7: The monks heard the complaints of those people,
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk37:1.8: and the monks of few desires complained and criticized those monks,
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk37:1.9: “How can the monks from the group of six do this?” …
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk37:1.10: “Is it true, monks, that you do this?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk37:1.13: “… Foolish men, how can you do this?
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk37:1.14: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it …
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk37:1.15: And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk37:1.16.1: ‘“I will not ask for bean curry or rice for myself and then eat it,” this is how you should train.’
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk37:1.17: In this way the Buddha laid down this training rule for the monks.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk37:2.1: Soon afterwards a number of monks were sick.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk37:2.2: The monks who were looking after them asked,
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk37:2.3: “We hope you’re bearing up; we hope you’re getting better?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk37:2.4: “Previously we ate rice and bean curry that we ourselves had asked for, and then we were comfortable.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk37:2.6: that the Buddha has prohibited this, we don’t ask because we’re afraid of wrongdoing. And because of that we’re not comfortable.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk37:2.7: They told the Buddha. Soon afterwards he gave a teaching and addressed the monks:
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk37:2.8: “Monks, I allow a sick monk to eat rice and bean curry that he himself has asked for.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk37:2.9: And so, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk37:2.10.1: ‘“When not sick, I will not ask for bean curry or rice for myself and then eat it,” this is how you should train.’
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk37:2.11: When one is not sick, one should not ask for bean curry or rice for oneself and then eat it.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk37:2.12: If a monk who is not sick, out of disrespect, eats bean curry or rice that he himself has asked for, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk37:2.19: if it is from those who have given an invitation;
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk37:2.20: if it is for the benefit of someone else;
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk37:2.21: if it is by means of his own property;
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk37:2.24: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk37:2.25: The seventh training rule is finished.
